item.title: Cyber attacks that occurred this year and how you can protect your data
item.description: More than 500 data breaches were reported in Australia over the first half of 2025 alone, but there are some ways you can minimise your risk of being caught up in one.

item.title: How the teen social media ban is impacting Australia’s multicultural communities
item.description: Sydney teenager Ilia Kyrychenko was relieved to delete his accounts after the social media ban, but the change is making it more difficult to connect with his loved ones in Ukraine.

item.title: Experts say climate change bigger threat to biodiversity than renewable energy projects
item.description: As the green energy boom gathers pace, experts say climate change is a bigger threat to biodiversity than wind farms and other renewables projects.

item.title: Mother pushes for safer pool fences as Victorian family marks a year since drowning
item.description: A woman is calling for tougher pool fencing regulations after her daughter crawled through a faulty fence and drowned in a neighbour’s pool.

item.title: Man charged with two counts of murder after stabbing at Quakers Hill in Sydney
item.description: Emergency services were called to a Quakers Hill home just before 5am after reports of a disturbance to discover a woman dead and a man fatally wounded.

item.title: What was on summer reading lists 100 years ago, in 1925?
item.description: There are books from authors that would become household names — F. Scott Fitzgerald and A.A Milne among them — and books that are now banned in some countries. But what can we learn from what people were reading in 1925?

item.title: Mentors gave me confidence to navigate life with a disability. Now I'm giving back
item.description: Other people with lived experience of blindness gave ABC reporter Nas Campanella the confidence to navigate life. Her mentee, Lily, is enjoying similar benefits.

item.title: A rescued dingo puppy explores its new surroundings.
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Dingo management should be 'non-lethal', traditional owners say
item.description: When Sonya sees a black-and-tan dingo, she feels a connection to family and Country, but many landholders see them as livestock-killing pests. Can graziers and dingoes co-exist?

item.title: Kennedy Center boss criticises musician who cancelled performance after Trump rebrand
item.description: Musician Chuck Redd cancelled his Christmas Eve show days after the White House announced the venue would be renamed the Trump Kennedy Center.

item.title: Weatherald, Labuschagne, Green under Ashes selection pressure after MCG loss
item.description: Jake Weatherald, Marnus Labuschagne and Cameron Green all face selection pressure following double failures in Australia's jarring loss at the MCG.

item.title: What to know about the Islamic State militants targeted by US air strikes
item.description: With US President Donald Trump hinting at plans for further strikes on IS militants in Nigeria, here's a rundown on what you need to know about the conflict.

item.title: Hands-on memories spark connection for dementia residents at western NSW aged care home
item.description: Creating meaningful, sensory activities for people living with dementia can be challenging, particularly when many traditional options feel more suited to children than adults with a lifetime of lived experience behind them.

item.title: Police investigate death of woman in Port Macquarie
item.description: A crime scene has been established after a woman died from unexplained injuries in New South Wales.

item.title: Man charged for allegedly displaying hate symbol tattoos at Newcastle beach
item.description: A man has been charged for allegedly displaying what police have called "hate symbol" tattoos at a beach in Newcastle.

item.title: From soapboxes to social media: Two artists shaping Queensland's bush art scene
item.description: Marion Moore is 101. Zarabella Bambling is 23. Despite their differences, both women have just celebrated the same major achievement as bush artists.

item.title: Why getting more migrants to swim has benefits for all of Australian society
item.description: Despite wanting to learn how to swim, many from culturally and linguistically diverse communities — particularly adults — face three key barriers to participating.

item.title: The case of the Guayaquil Four places scrutiny on Ecuador's security crackdown
item.description: In the weeks before Christmas, four boys under 16 left home to play a game of soccer. Their forced disappearance at the hands of Ecuador's military has been labelled a national "turning point".

item.title: 'Grumpy' seal disrupts Blairgowrie boat race on Victoria's Mornington Peninsula
item.description: A wild seal dubbed "Grumpy" causes some commotion at an annual boat race on the Mornington Peninsula, outside Melbourne.

item.title: MCG curator Matt Page admits Boxing Day Test pitch 'favoured the bowlers too much'
item.description: MCC boss Stuart Fox staunchly defends chief curator Matt Page after a wild Boxing Day Test finishes within two days.

item.title: Man charged with assaulting Labor identity Tim Picton granted bail in Perth court
item.description: A 20-year-old man is granted bail after allegedly assaulting Tim Picton, a prominent Labor Party identity — an attack police prosecutors say may leave him permanently disabled, if he survives.

item.title: SA independent MP Nick McBride charged with assault
item.description: Police say they responded to reports of a domestic assault at a home in South Australia's south-east on Saturday.

item.title: Sending army to protect Sydney's Jewish community not ruled out by NSW premier
item.description: Sydneysiders can expect to see more police officers carrying long-armed guns in the weeks ahead, with the premier not ruling out sending troops to protect the Jewish community.

item.title: Taiwan's cunning tax compliance makes most shopping receipts a ticket in a lottery
item.description: Most shopping receipts in Taiwan are also tickets for a lottery run every second month by the government to increase tax compliance, and there are some big prizes up for grabs.

item.title: Police say Indigenous woman's death in custody was result of 'medical episode'
item.description: Northern Territory Police say the death in custody of an Indigenous woman in Tennant Creek on Saturday was the result of a "medical episode", while admitting there was no nurse on duty at the time.

item.title: Teenagers charged after alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east
item.description: An overnight police chase across multiple suburbs has ended with the arrest of three teenagers after an alleged aggravated carjacking in Melbourne's south-east.

item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot, iconic French actor, sex symbol and animal rights campaigner, dies aged 91
item.description: The French actor and singer was a screen siren of the 1950s and 1960s who in later life became a prominent animal rights campaigner.

item.title: Brigitte Bardot was the world's 'sex kitten'. Her nonchalance was all French
item.description: Few epitomised French chic like Brigitte Bardot, the doe-eyed beauty whose sensuality rocked a post-war world.

item.title: Families of Bondi victims call for federal royal commission
item.description: Loved ones of those killed and injured in the Bondi Beach attack say rising antisemitism requires a "powerful national response", piling pressure on Anthony Albanese for a royal commission.

item.title: Nick Kyrgios defeats Aryna Sabalenka in latest 'battle of the sexes'
item.description: Australia's Nick Kyrgios defeated women's world number one Aryna Sabalenka in the latest "battle of the sexes". The Aussie, who has fallen outside the ATP top 600 after barely playing for three years, won 6-3, 6-3.

item.title: A growing number of older women surfers are showing age is just a state of mind
item.description: When Katie Pahlow turned 60, she decided to finally bite the bullet and book herself in for some surf lessons.

item.title: Sarah Larcombe's journey back to the top of the paraclimbing world after devastating injuries
item.description: When Sarah Larcombe fell off Mount Arapiles in February, she thought she just sprained her ankle. What followed was months of ups and downs ending in a stunning world championships result.

item.title: Aid agencies fear lifesaving program banned in Gaza under new Israeli requirements
item.description: The Israeli government has introduced new rules for aid organisations, including that they must not engage in any activities or criticism which "delegitimise" the state of Israel.

item.title: Australia's driver courtesy wave dying out, say truckies, but experiment proves wave still alive on back roads
item.description: For generations, the courtesy wave has been etched into the Australian culture, but is it on the verge of dying?

item.title: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says progress made on peace deal, but Donald Trump says 'thorny issues' remain
item.description: Volodymyr Zelenskyy says a security guarantee between Ukraine and the US as part of a peace deal is "100 per cent agreed", while Donald Trump says there are still one or two "thorny issues" to finalise in the deal.

item.title: Concerns medical weight-loss treatments are being advertised to vulnerable eating disorder patients
item.description: Eating disorder bodies are raising concerns about weight-loss treatments being prescribed by telehealth companies, one of which ran a Black Friday sale to promote its services.

item.title: Young women join Country Women's Association Sydney branch in droves
item.description: More young women are joining the Country Women's Association's city branches, with a passion for jams and scones along with social connection and purpose.

item.title: Voter turnout lower than expected in Myanmar's first election since 2020
item.description: Myanmar's election has been widely dismissed as a sham by many governments and human rights activists who have said the military will use proxy candidates to legitimise their rule.

item.title: Travis Head happy to see out Ashes as Australian opener before working out future role
item.description: Australia star Travis Head says he is not precious about continuing to open the batting beyond this Ashes and will bat wherever the coaches tell him to.

item.title: AI powered 2025's economy to record highs. So why are only robots smiling?
item.description: This year saw economies survive tariff shocks and markets burst through record highs, but it doesn't feel like a party because so many people aren't invited.

item.title: Deadly varroa mite threatens half of Canberra’s beehives
item.description: A fast-spreading parasite is expected to devastate local bee colonies over the next two years, affecting commercial and backyard crops.

item.title: LGBTQIA+ focused boxing class combatting loneliness amid warnings about social isolation
item.description: One in three adults experience social isolation in what experts say is a "dangerous" issue in society. One suburban boxing group is working to tackle the issue, focused on the LGBTQIA+ community more at risk of loneliness.

item.title: Cyclone Hayley upgraded to category two system, as northern WA residents told to prepare
item.description: Residents in WA's north are on alert following the formation of Tropical Cyclone Hayley off the coast overnight.

item.title: Wet season's arrival prompts moves to shore up food security in Far North Queensland
item.description: Earlier this year, a once-in-a-century flood devastated Ingham and cut the main supply route between Cairns and Townsville. Now, as intense rainfall once again triggers multiple warnings and floods roads across northern Queensland, communities are taking steps to prevent another food shortage.

item.title: How vintage black-and-white films are making a splash back in colour
item.description: Would those classic black-and-white films be the same if viewed in full colour?

item.title: Victorian master builder transforms Warrnambool house into castle for his son
item.description: They say "a man's home is his castle," but one builder from south-west Victoria has taken that literally when creating a dream home for his son.

item.title: Mexico train crash kills passengers in country's south
item.description: Another five people are in a critical condition after the Interoceanic Train detailed in the southern state of Oaxana.

item.title: NSW government sets up hub to assist those impacted by Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: The Bondi Hub will be open to the community and those directly or indirectly impacted by the December 14 shooting at the Chanukah by the Sea event at Bondi Beach, where 15 people were killed.

item.title: Australia coach Andrew McDonald says Usman Khawaja will play the final Ashes Test amid retirement speculation
item.description: Usman Khawaja will play in the Ashes finale at the SCG, but Australian coach Andrew McDonald remains in the dark about the 39-year-old's future beyond that.

item.title: Anthony Albanese announces terms for Richardson review of Bondi terrorist attack
item.description: The PM says a former head of ASIO will assess whether multiple security and law agencies worked as effectively as they should have before the attack.

item.title: NT police arrest woman for allegedly stealing from patients in Alice Springs Hospital
item.description: A 30-year-old woman faces court after allegedly stealing from multiple elderly patients recovering from surgery in Alice Springs Hospital over an extended period.

item.title: Coolongolook Rural Fire Service volunteers 'gutted' after robbery during fire season
item.description: The volunteers discovered the theft when they arrived at the Coolongolook RFS shed to attend a car crash. Thieves stole hoses, breathing masks, radios and chainsaws.

item.title: England's pace bowling stocks stripped bare with Gus Atkinson out of SCG Test
item.description: England's pace bowling stocks will be stretched to their absolute limit for the final Ashes Test with Gus Atkinson ruled out with a hamstring injury.

item.title: Ahmed Al Ahmed recounts how he disarmed one of the gunmen in Bondi Beach terrorist attack
item.description: Father-of-two Ahmed Al Ahmed, who risked his life to disarm one of the Bondi gunmen during a terrorist attack, says he feels sorry for the 15 people who were killed.

item.title: The right way to stack your dishwasher and the verdict on rinsing beforehand
item.description: Rinsing can actually send a message to your dishwasher that your plate doesn't need as much washing.

item.description: China has moved its military to surround Taiwan warning against its independence. But Beijing's action has been condemned by Taiwan calling for regional peace and de-escalation.

item.description: Those now safely onshore after finishing the 2025 Sydney to Hobart tell of "horrendous" conditions, resulting in injuries, broken boats and seasickness — even among experienced crew members.

item.description: Kim Keon Hee, the wife of disgraced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol, is alleged to have accepted lavish bribes including fine art, jewellery and designer handbags, and to have meddled in state affairs.

item.description: A decade after his death in a Sydney prison, David Dungay Jr's family hold with a memorial rally calling for change to a corrections system they say still fails to protect Indigenous people.

item.description: Looking for screen-time options that won't leave your kids overstimulated? 'Slow TV' shows, with their soothing visuals and soundtracks, could be the answer.

item.description: He has already proven his quality away from home, but heading into the final Test of the Ashes summer, Cameron Green remains in search of his breakthrough moment in Australia.

item.description: Last-minute amendments to Queensland's double jeopardy laws could allow for the retrial of botched DNA cases.

item.description: Hundreds of kilograms of shark heads have been left dumped outside the WA Fisheries minister's office in Margaret River, just three days before a permanent commercial demersal fishing ban comes into effect.

item.description: The ICC has handed down their verdict on the controversial MCG pitch which led to this year's Boxing Day Test wrapping up after just two days.

item.title: Today in History, December 30: Beatles star George Harrison stabbed at home
item.description: Unlike his former bandmate John Lennon, George Harrison survived an attack by a fan, but the musician's friends and family speculated it hastened his death less than two years later.

item.title: Your most read ABC News stories of 2025

item.title: What happened when we tested a 'safe' AI mental health chatbot
item.description: Is it possible to make a "safe" AI therapy bot? We tested the limits of a new Australian-designed chatbot that's been carefully designed not to hallucinate or be your best friend.

item.title: Household battery uptake booms on back of 'game-changer' rebate

item.description: In a broad-ranging interview for the Politics Now podcast, the rising Labor star reveals he plans to take extended leave to care for his baby daughter.

item.description: Police are looking for a man who allegedly tried to steal a woman's car in Richmond earlier this year but was foiled by bystanders, including one person wielding a golf club.

item.description: It is not unheard of for the ground to shake in Broken Hill, but what is unusual is the number of earthquakes recorded by Geoscience Australia this year.

item.description: Tropical Cyclone Hayley continues to barrel towards the Dampier Peninsula on the Western Australian coast, where residents are being told to prepare for "severe impacts" when it makes landfall tonight.

item.title: Hobart Hurricanes beat Melbourne Renegades thanks to vital cameo from Matthew Wade
item.description: Matthew Wade's fuss-free cameo helps Hobart chase down the Melbourne Renegades's 163 at Bellerive Oval, lifting the Hurricanes well clear of the pack in second spot.

item.title: Hiker Stella Thurbon leads herd of goats on trek through Victoria's High Country
item.description: With bells tinkling, tails flicking, and panniers packed to the brim, adventurer Stella Thurbon has spent 26 days winding through the Victorian High Country with nine goats trotting faithfully behind her.

item.title: Noongar elders say WA prescribed burn went ahead despite warnings of cultural heritage sites
item.description: Elders on WA's south coast say they tried to warn the state government about unregistered cultural sites in the path of a prescribed burn, but the burn went ahead anyway.

item.description: A US strike on Venezuelan soil would be the first known land attack in the country since the Trump administration began ratcheting up pressure on its ruling regime, which Donald Trump accuses of "narco-terrorism".

item.description: A 15-year-old carrying a hunting knife was among more than 100 arrests during the first few weeks of a police operation at four of Melbourne's biggest shopping centres.

item.description: Researchers from Charles Darwin University are leading the way in the fight to protect a group of globally threatened fish species, which look like "a shark and ray joined together".

item.description: Cochlear implants can be a life-changing tool for people with hearing loss, but some Deaf people argue their use risks compromising their community's identity.

item.title: Justice Department slammed for lack of strategic leadership as problems mount within WA prison system
item.description: A wide-ranging review into Western Australia's Justice Department finds that "forward planning is often overshadowed by immediate operational demands" which means it fails to address rising pressures like prison overcrowding.

item.description: Daria Kasatkina is being backed to return from her mental health break and quickly become a fan favourite at her new home grand slam, the Australian Open.

item.description: The two-person crewed BNC is the current favourite to secure an overall victory in the Sydney to Hobart, after crossing the finish line at 10:40 this morning.

item.description: Metal detectorist Dale Oldham at first thought he had found a rusted Australian coin, until an online search revealed it was something much older and far more exotic.

item.description: A fire that burnt through 1,200 hectares of vegetation and destroyed two houses started in a residential fire pit, Tasmanian authorities say.

item.description: South Australia avoided a major bushfire as the state sweltered through a day of extreme danger on Monday, while two structure fires left a damage bill of $1 million.

item.description: The storm has been downgraded after bringing severe winds and heavy rain to parts of the north-west Kimberley.

item.title: South Korea bans bear bile farming with jail for those who breach the law
item.description: South Korea is one of the few countries that allow farming to extract bile from bears, for traditional medicine or food believed to promote vitality and stamina.

item.title: Eurostar train services cancelled across Europe due to power issue
item.description: A disruption on Tuesday prompted the rail company to request train customers postpone their journeys until another time.

item.title: Christmas cruise ends in chaos as Coral Adventurer passengers return home
item.description: About 80 passengers on the Coral Adventurer are flown home after the cruise ship ran aground on a reef off Papua New Guinea.

item.title: UAE withdraws personnel from Yemen after Saudi Arabia air strikes
item.description: The UAE has denied shipping weapons to Yemeni separatists after Saudi-led forces said they had bombed arms at the port city of Mukalla.

item.title: ABC Sports Quiz: The year that was 2025
item.description: It was another big year in sport, with Ashes series, world cups, world championships and a long-awaited comeback.

item.title: Today in History, December 31: Vladimir Putin rises to power in Russia
item.description: Vladimir Putin has towered over politics in Russia since ascending to the country's top office, initially as president for eight years, then as prime minister until that pesky thing called the constitution could be altered to allow him to run again.

item.title: The operators issuing fake corporate licences in the name of a tiny African island
item.description: An ABC investigation has identified several individuals involved in a network of illegitimate corporate regulators and service firms.

item.title: Kakadu traditional owner says nature has long warned us about rising sea levels
item.description: In wet season, Jonathan and his family have to drive, boat and drive again if they want to reach town. The remote NT traditional owner says nature has long been warning us about climate change, "but nobody's listening".

item.title: Crowd-funding business campaigns falter, despite demand for tipple
item.description: Brewer Richard Jeffares's Victorian company raised about $2.5 million from 993 investors in a matter of days through a method called crowd-sourced funding, also known as equity crowdfunding.

item.title: Sportsbet pressured key watchdog into 'watering down' enforcement announcement
item.description: Gambling giant Sportsbet pressured the Australian Communications and Media Authority into "watering down" enforcement announcement, the ABC can reveal.

item.title: Human-operated Tokyo robot venture allows housebound people to work
item.description: Ory Yoshifuji's Tokyo business employs housebound individuals to operate robots as waitstaff at a cafe and as personal tour guides in the city.

item.title: What should you do during a violent mass attack?
item.description: The mass shooting in Bondi and other incidents of mass violence around the world have highlighted that violence can strike anywhere. Here are some expert tips on how to escape, hide, and stay safe.

item.title: Denmark becomes first country in world to end letter delivery
item.description: After 401 years, the Danish postal service has ended letter deliveries as the country fully embraces the digital age.

item.title: Robbers steal $52 million from vault of German savings bank
item.description: According to police, the robbers drilled their way into the underground vault room of the savings bank from a parking garage.

item.title: For many South Australians, 2025 could be summarised as the year of searching for answers
item.description: As 2025 draws to a close and we look back at the stories that made headlines, for South Australians the year could be summarised as one where we searched for answers, with little results.

item.title: Mechanic shortage driving Queensland businesses to look overseas for qualified workers
item.description: The automotive repair industry says it is dealing with a major labour and skills shortage, and some mechanics are looking overseas for workers.

item.title: ASX ends 'stressful' year with gold and lithium stocks surging despite Trump's trade war threats
item.description: Several gold, lithium and other mining stocks have seen their share price double, and even triple, in 2025 as Australia's share market has had a much better than expected year despite tariffs, economic uncertainty and Donald Trump's ongoing unpredictability.

item.title: Tatiana Schlossberg, granddaughter of John F Kennedy, dies aged 35
item.description: Tatiana Schlossberg revealed in an essay published in November that she had a rare form of terminal leukaemia.

item.title: Perth Scorchers beat Sydney Thunder by 71 runs in Sydney, Ashton Turner stuck on 99 not out
item.description: Ashton Turner narrowly misses out on a maiden BBL century as he helps launch Perth to a crucial 71-run win over the Sydney Thunder.

item.title: Flocks of tourists dubbed the 'koala paparazzi' putting animals at risk in Byron Bay
item.description: Large crowds of tourists gather daily at the bottom of trees home to koalas in Byron Bay, leaving the animals stressed and their habitat trampled.

item.title: Record year for Australian beef exports despite Donald Trump's tariffs
item.description: When Donald Trump enforced a 10 per cent tariff on Australian beef, there were some concerns it would impact trade. But the opposite happened.

item.title: Calls for tighter regulations after Woodside knowingly shed plastic into ocean
item.description: Documents reveal one of Australia's biggest oil and gas companies knowingly shed plastic into the ocean for two months before notifying the offshore regulator.

item.title: Flooding claims a life as deluge cuts north-west Queensland roads, isolates towns
item.description: Police have renewed warnings about driving in floodwaters after a tragedy in Queensland's Gulf Country as the region endures a fourth day of drenching rain.

item.title: What are the new rules in 2026? Here's what's changing from New Year's Day
item.description: New Year's Day brings a host of new laws, regulations and guidelines into effect. Here's a quick breakdown of some of the changes.

item.title: AI technology gives swimming pool lifeguards an extra set of eyes this summer
item.description: An AI system used in 120 public pools across Australia analyses swimmers' movements and sends an alert to a lifeguard's smartwatch if it detects someone in trouble.

item.title: Max Verstappen wins F1 Driver of the Year award for fifth straight year, Oscar Piastri comes fourth
item.description: Max Verstappen may not have won the F1 world title, but his fast finish to the year wins him Driver of the Year for the fifth straight year, while Oscar Piastri's disappointing end to the season is mirrored in the voting.

item.title: Russia claims nuclear-capable Oreshnik missiles have been deployed in Belarus
item.description: Belarusian President Alexander Lukashenko, a staunch ally of the Kremlin, announced the deployment of the Oreshnik intermediate-range ballistic missiles earlier this month.

item.title: Photos that captured the stories and people of regional WA in 2025
item.description: The stunning photos that captured the stories and people of regional WA in 2025.

item.title: Broken Hill gardeners chop down trees in battle with Queensland fruit fly
item.description: There was no fruit fly to be found in Broken Hill 20 years ago, but now gardeners are facing an uphill battle trying to rid themselves of the pest.

item.title: Calls for national strategy to tackle apprentice hazing and protect workers’ mental health
item.description: TV presenter and former builder Barry Du Bois is lobbying Canberra for change.

item.title: Bushfire near Rockingham in Perth's south contained but not controlled as second WA blaze downgraded
item.description: More than 140 firefighters spend a second night battling an out-of-control blaze near Rockingham, in Perth's southern suburbs, as an emergency warning for a second fire in WA's South West is downgraded.

item.title: Costumes of Kylie, Rihanna, Lady Gaga, Amy Taylor and more showcased in new DIVA exhibition
item.description: The exhibition at Melbourne's newest museum, featuring Kylie Minogue's catsuit and Elton John's Louis XIV-inspired 50th birthday outfit, celebrates the power of divas through time.

item.title: Min River takes out overall win in 2025 Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race after protest against BNC
item.description: Double-handed Min River makes history by becoming the first double-handed yacht to take out the overall win in the Sydney to Hobart Yacht Race and the first to do so with a female skipper.

item.title: Race committee chair Lee Goddard announces the protest has been upheld
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Former Australian Test batsman Damien Martyn in an induced coma with meningitis
item.description: Former Australian Test and limited overs batsman Damien Martyn is in hospital in Queensland in an induced coma after falling ill this week.

item.title: Promise of bumper coffee crop in 2026 fuelled by explosion of white flowers
item.description: Australian coffee growers are hoping for a bumper 2026 season to meet increased demand for homegrown beans following a prolific flowering season.

item.title: Revellers gather at sites across Australia for New Year's Eve celebrations
item.description: Revellers are gathering to farewell 2025 at various sites across Australia's major cities, including Sydney, where there is a heavy police presence in the wake of the Bondi terror attack earlier this month.

item.title: Ashes 2025: Alex Hartley responds to criticism for talking about period on BBC commentary
item.description: Alex Hartley says she was stunned by the reaction to her talking about her period during the BBC's radio commentary of the third Ashes Test.

item.title: Tom Kenny and Mark Hamill on SpongeBob's 'multi-generational appeal'

item.title: BNC lost Sydney to Hobart race honours due to use of pole extending past the boat
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: 'White Australia' flyer letterbox drop in Newcastle sparks police investigation
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns said police would "throw the book" at anyone behind flyers distributed to inner-city Newcastle letterboxes.

item.title: Crown casino workers in Melbourne announce New Year's Eve strike amid wage row
item.description: About 500 workers at Melbourne's Crown casino will stop work tonight after rejecting a proposal they say will cut pay for new workers and imperil those currently employed.

item.title: Dolphin Sands residents report looting after bushfire destroys 19 homes
item.description: After 19 homes were destroyed by bushfire in a picturesque east coast Tasmanian community, residents are now reporting instances of looting — described by the state premier as "disgraceful".

item.title: Kimberley homes lose roofs as emergency services respond to ex-Tropical Cyclone Hayley
item.description: Emergency services travel to the Dampier Peninsula to assess the damage caused by the category three system, which crossed the coast on Tuesday afternoon.

item.title: Socceroos striker Martin Boyle in injury blow for Hibernian
item.description: Martin Boyle, no stranger to the heartache of missing major tournaments with the Socceroos, was taken off after injuring his hamstring for Hibernian in the Scottish Premiership.

item.title: One dead in train crash near Machu Picchu, tourists among dozens injured
item.description: A head-on collision between two tourist trains near Peru's most famous landmark kills a train driver and injures dozens.

item.title: Australia's top glassmakers are the focus of the exhibition Glass Chrysalis II
item.description: The art of glassblowing was popularised in a recent reality TV series, but these Australian artists are forging their own paths in the creative process of sculpting this tricky medium.

item.title: Queensland's new public child sex offender register now live under Daniel's Law
item.description: Queenslanders can search their local area for reportable sex offenders by providing proof of identification.

item.title: Cyclone Alfred, exam bungles and revenge debt: Your most read Queensland stories of 2025
item.description: From cyclones to earthquakes and everything in between, here are the most read Queensland ABC News stories of 2025.

item.title: Emergency workers carry away the injured after Machu Picchu train collision
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Muslim community members sleep in mosques as Islamophobic threats rise after Bondi mass shooting
item.description: A rise in Islamophobic incidents prompts warnings from Muslim organisations that their communities are at risk of "retribution" and "collective punishment" following the mass shooting.

item.title: Sunshine Coast live music venue The Station to shut down as event bookings drop
item.description: The Sunshine Coast's largest live music venue is shutting down, with the owners stating that they need double the number of bookings to stay afloat.

item.title: Alleged car thief, home invader found after two-day police hunt in Latrobe Valley
item.description: The two-day police search for a man who allegedly went on a crime spree in Latrobe Valley has ended with a stolen car crashing through a garden wall.

item.title: How BNC lost the Sydney to Hobart after 'silly mistake' breaches sailing rule
item.description: They should be celebrating a historic win — instead, the crew of BNC is coming to terms with how a "silly mistake" cost them the "crown jewel" prize of Sydney to Hobart overall handicap.

item.title: BNC co-skippers Yann Rigal and Michel Quintin react to protest result
item.description: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

item.title: Driver in hit and run that killed woman on Darwin's Bagot road remains at large
item.description: The search for a hit-and-run driver who allegedly struck and killed a 27-year-old Indigenous woman on one of Darwin's busiest main roads continues into its fifth day.

item.title: Pet owner's warning as dogs fall ill after beach visit amid algal bloom crisis
item.description: Within 20 minutes of leaving an Adelaide beach dogs Lucy and Ella began breathing rapidly and fell "terribly sick", prompting their owner to issue a warning.

item.title: Car culture rolling strong in SA as unofficial event attracts thousands
item.description: Despite becoming unofficial several years ago, a community-driven event has attracted about 1,000 drivers and even more spectators in Adelaide.

item.title: Man drowns and boy missing after boat capsizes at Palm Beach
item.description: Police confirmed one man has drowned and a 14-year-old boy is missing after their boat capsized at Palm Beach on Sydney's Northern Beaches, with a search and rescue helicopter continuing to search the area.

item.title: Felix Auger-Aliassime hopes for deep Australian Open run after career-best year
item.description: After his best year on tour, Canadian star Felix Auger-Aliassime is looking to keep his hot streak running in the United Cup and at the Australian Open.

item.title: Protests in Iran as inflation takes hold

item.title: Iranian president admits protesters have 'legitimate demands' as inflation fuels unrest
item.description: Protests over soaring prices and a collapsing currency are spreading across Iran, with students joining shopkeepers in calling on the government to take action.

item.title: Wednesday Finance with Dan Ziffer
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Charges laid over alleged threats to The Age journalist Nick McKenzie
item.description: Investigators from a taskforce targeting crime in the construction industry say a 31-year-old man threatened journalist Nick McKenzie in a Christmas Eve call.
